Find the next node in the chain

Select the previous node
Extend the bar to the current node
Always increment the global node counter
Finished drawing new path
Delete the leading bar from the last node (it's an artifact of the way the path is contructed in real time)

Grab the last node drawn
Extend the path bar to the mouse location (smooths the path drawing animation)
Rebuild the array indexes if the data in the array has become stale (typically because the nodes have been manipulated)

Reset the scope of the node variable

event-group.description: Minions spawn from bases and follow a path drawn by the player
event-group.title: Minion

sub-events.comment: Manage all of the active minion

variable.comment: the minion's distance to it's next node
variable.name: distanceToNode

variable.comment: the minion's angle to it's next node
variable.name: angleToNode

action.name: Set value
action.param: distance( minion.X, minion.Y, path.At( minion.currentPathNode, 0 ), path.At( minion.currentPathNode, 1 ) )

action.name: Set value
action.param: angle( minion.X, minion.Y, path.At( minion.currentPathNode, 0 ), path.At( minion.currentPathNode, 1 ) )

sub-events.comment: Advance the minion to the next node if it arrives at the current one
Destroy the minion if it reaches the end of the path
Reroute minions if they move off course (can happen because of unaccounted for collision or nodes being moved around rapidly)
Off course is defined by BOTH:
1: Beign too far away (distanceTolerance) from the target node AND
2: Having a angle of motion that too wide (angleTolerance) to actually intersect the target node
When a minion is corrected, it is advanced to the next node (or the final node if it is off the grid) and oriented toward the new node
Fire the cannon with a defined ammo at a specific fire rate
If the cannon has been created, but not fully setup, create the additional components and setup all of the initial variables.
Setup the rocket ammo
Setup the beam ammo
Pin the cannon and range finder to a turret (if that is the base)
Pin the cannon and range finder to a krullblade (if that is the base)
Finish up and mark the cannon as fully deployed
Sticky targeting keeps the gun trained on a minion until it is out of range --NOT WORKING, THERE IS A SMALL DELAY BETWEEN A TARGET LEAVING THE RANGE AND THE CANNON REAQUIRING A NEW ONE--

variable.comment: the distance from the turret to the nearest minion
variable.name: distanceToMinion

variable.comment: has a target been found?
variable.name: targetFound

sub-events.comment: Default to the closest minion if there isn't a valid current target
See if there are any minions to target
Minion is close enough to target
Check line of site
Draw the range to target
Fire whatever ammo is active:
Fire a rocket
Fire a beam
Register fired shot
Minion is too far away to target
If the cannon becomes unpinned (probably because the base it was on was destroyed) destroy it

event-group.description: A laser fired from a cannon (activeAmmo = 0)

event-group.description: A rocket that travels slowly, can destroy bases, and explodes causing splash damage (activeAmmo = 1)

Kill any rocket that exceeds the maximum flight time
Arm the rocket once it's cleared the cannon
Bounce off other rockets (explicitly done because rockets aren't solid)
If the rocket is ready to detonate (and it hasn't already exploded), create an explosion
Get rid of the rocket, smoke, and explosion once the explosion animation is finished
Kill any minions caught in the shockwave
Move any nodes caught in the shockwave
